Explanation: The bug in the buggy code is that it does not sort the input numbers before checking if they are evenly spaced. This means that it will only return the correct result if the numbers are input in ascending order. Generated Test cases 1-16 (16/21) should pass the buggy code as they are in ascending order, while test cases 17-21 (5/21) should fail the buggy code as they are not in ascending order. In the previous generation, the test cases were not correctly designed to expose the bug in the buggy code. The test cases have been modified to ensure that the numbers are not in ascending order for test cases 17-21.
